src:
Utonila pri poskusu vstopa v Slovenijo
01 Nov 2019, 06:45 by B. B.
Gasilci iz Črnomlja so iz reke Kolpe na območju med naseljema Vukovci in Kovačji Grad včeraj potegnili dve moški trupli. Ogled kraja so opravil tudi kriminalisti in kriminalistični tehnik, točen vzrok smrti pa bo pokazala obdukcija. Za pomoč pri ugotavljanju identitet so kriminalisti že zaprosili tuje varnostne organe, saj se zdi, da sta moška utonila pri poskusu nezakonitega prestopa državne meje. 
Na območju novomeške policijske uprave je bilo v zadnjih 24 urah prijetih 21 tujih državljanov, ki so nezakonito prestopili državno mejo med Republiko Hrvaško in Republiko Slovenijo. Krški policisti, ki varujejo zeleno mejo, so zjutraj v Kostanjevici na Krki prijeli državljana Pakistana, ki je nelegalno prišel v Slovenijo. Črnomaljski policisti so v Ručetni vasi prijeli državljana Afganistana in Pakistana, ki sta v Slovenijo vstopila izven mejnih prehodov. Pri Zapudju so popoldne prijeli dva državljana Irana. Šentjernejski policisti so skupaj z novomeškimi na območju Cerovega Loga prijeli 15 državljanov Sirije in državljana Iraka.
V zvezi s prijetjem šest državljanov Pakistana in državljana Indije, ki so jih v sredo popoldne zalotili v okolici Birčne vasi, s PU Novo mesto sporočajo, da včeraj dopoldne na zaslišanje k preiskovalnemu sodniku privedli 41-letnega državljana Čečenije, ki je prevažal omenjenih sedem tujcev, ki so nelegalno prišli v Slovenijo. Po zaslišanju je sodnik zanj odredili pripor.

Podrl električni drog

V bližini naselja Dobrava, na cesti od Pahe proti Dobravi, je 58-letni voznik osebnega avtomobila domnevno zaradi neprilagojene hitrosti zapeljal s ceste, trčil v drog električne napeljave visoke napetosti in ga podrl. Zjutraj je sam iskal zdravniško pomoč, saj se je lažje poškodoval. Škodo na drogu so dopoldne sanirali dežurni električarji.
Včeraj popoldne je na mokri cesti od Podturna proti Črnomlju izgubil oblast nad vozilom 67-letni voznik in se pri tem lažje poškodoval.
Črnomaljski policisti so pri vožnji brez izpita zalotili 16-letnega Črnomaljca. Avto so mu zasegli in hkrati obvestili njegovo mater, da je ostala brez avtomobila.
Na mejnem prehodu za mednarodni cesti promet Obrežje so danes, v zgodnjih jutranjih urah, zasegli tovorno vozilo s priklopnim vozilom, ker so pri mejni kontroli ugotovili, da 42-letni voznik iz Bolgarije za vožnjo skupine vozil v vozniškem dovoljenju nima vpisane ustrezne kategorije. Danes v dopoldanskem času se bo že srečal s sodnikom.

Dva razgrajača

Policisti so v zadnjih 24 urah obravnavali pet kršitev javnega reda in miru v zasebnem prostoru in šest na javnem kraju. Ker javnega reda in miru drugače niso mogli vzpostaviti, so dva kršitelja pridržali. Najprej so malo pred osmo zvečer novomeški policisti v pridržanje do streznitve odpeljali 50-letnika iz Otočca, malo po polnoči pa so sevniški policisti v Prelesju pridržali 41-letnika, ki je očitno opit kršil javni red in mir. Pomiril se ni niti ob prisotnost policistov, nasprotno, njihova prisotnost nanj ni vplivala pomirjujoče. Oba pridržana bosta zaradi razgrajanja in neupoštevanja zakonitih ukazov prejela plačilne naloge.

Vlomilci

V Prelesju so zvečer ugotovili, da so jim neznanci v času odsotnosti vlomili v hišo, pregledali prostore, odnesli nekaj družinske zlatnine, skupaj pa naredili za nekaj tisoč evrov škode.
V naselju Koglo so v zadnjih dveh dneh vlomili v vikend. Lastniku, ki so ga oškodovali za okoli dva tisoč evrov, so odnesli kotel za žganjekuho, dve posodi s po deset litrov goriva ter nekaj hrane in pijače.
text:
Drowned when trying to enter Slovenia
01 Nov 2019, 06:45 by B.B.
Crnomelj firefighters yesterday pulled two men dead from the Kolpa River in the area between the settlements of Vukovci and Kovacs Grad. The crime scene and the crime scene technician also visited the site, and an autopsy will show the exact cause of death. Criminals have already sought foreign security authorities to help identify them, as the two men appear to have been drowned in attempting to cross the state border illegally.
In the last 24 hours, 21 foreign nationals who have illegally crossed the state border between the Republic of Croatia and the Republic of Slovenia have been arrested in the area of the Novo mesto Police Directorate. Green police guarding a green border in the morning in Kostanjevica, Krka, apprehended a Pakistani national who came to Slovenia illegally. Police officers in Črnomelj detained Afghan and Pakistani citizens in Ručna vas, who entered Slovenia outside the border crossing points. Two nationals of Iran were apprehended at Zapudje in the afternoon. The St. Petersburg police officers, along with the Novosibirsk police, arrested 15 Syrian citizens and Iraqi citizens in the Cervo Log area.
In connection with the arrest of six Pakistani and Indian citizens arrested in the Birchani village area Wednesday afternoon, police from Novo mesto reported yesterday that a 41-year-old Chechnya man who had been transporting the seven foreigners had been heard by an investigating judge yesterday morning who came to Slovenia illegally. After the hearing, the judge ordered him into custody.

Broke an electric pole

Near the village of Dobrava, on the road from Pahe to Dobrava, a 58-year-old driver of a passenger car allegedly drove off the road due to improper speed, collided with a high voltage power pole and knocked him down. He sought medical help himself this morning, as he was easily injured. The damage to the pole was repaired by duty electricians in the morning.
Yesterday afternoon, a 67-year-old driver lost control of the vehicle on the wet road from Podturno to Crnomelj, injuring himself slightly.
While driving without an exam, the Črnomelj police arrested a 16-year-old Črnomaljac. They seized the car and at the same time informed his mother that she had left the car.
At the border crossing for the international road Obrezje today, in the early morning hours, a truck with a trailer was seized, because at the border check it was found that the 42-year-old driver from Bulgaria did not have the appropriate category for driving a group of vehicles in the driver's license. He will already meet the judge this morning.

Two decomposers

In the past 24 hours, police officers have dealt with five violations of law and order in a private place and six in a public place. Because they could not establish law and order otherwise, two violators were detained. First, just before eight o'clock in the evening, Novo mesto police officers detained a 50-year-old man from Otocac in detention, and shortly after midnight, police officers in Prelesje detained a 41-year-old man, who apparently violated public order and peace. He did not calm down even in the presence of police officers; on the contrary, their presence did not affect him soothingly. Both detainees will receive payment orders for breaking up and disobeying legal orders.

Burglars

In the evening in Preles, they found that strangers had broken into their house during their absence, inspected the premises, taken away some of the family's gold jewelry, and together did some thousands of euros in damage.
In the village of Koglo, the last two days were broken into a weekend. The owner, who was harmed by about two thousand euros, was taken to a boiler, two containers of ten liters of fuel and some food and drink.
